item.title: Be More Ocean
item.description:
The aim of this series of programs was to communicate concepts of oceanography through a scientific expedition on the game Sea of ​​Thieves.

The journey was led by Professor Ernest Méduse, a talented explorer and ecologist, through various programs. Our goal was be to understand how the game's ecosystems work and whether they are scientifically plausible.

Several topics have been discussed:

  • physics (winds and currents)
  • geology
  • water chemistry
  • aquatic biology
  • land biology
  • human civilizations

item.title: Chouettos Cup
item.description:
The Chouettos Cup was a friendly competition offered to the community on Discord and during live broadcasts.

Inspired from the House Cup system in the Harry Potter universe, community members would join one of the three participating Societies during a livestream (random assignment in exchange for a few channel points ):

  • the Collectors of Science
  • the Knowledge Alliance
  • the Ordre of Scholars

Viewer interactions during livestreams would grant or lose points for their Society, and bonus points were awarded through monthly challenges to be completed on the community server. Proposed by the moderation team, these challenges allowed everyone to participate by organizing their efforts through dedicated discussion channels.

item.title: An ocean of knowledge
item.description:
To celebrate the 2024 Science Party, an event organized by the French Ministry of Higher Education and Research, I organized a special program to discuss scientific knowledge in the time of piracy. Accompanied by Astragale and Romain from the channel Le Flot de l’Histoire, we discussed many topics from debunking fantastic creatures to social sciences.

I also co-hosted a livestream on marine stations. We watched and discussed several videos about these places, their founders, and their importance for scientific research, including an excellent documentary on their history.

item.title: Science and gamedesign
item.description:
I interviewed Clémence Maurer, senior level designer for Unknown Worlds. She and her team participated in the development of the environments and creatures for the Subnautica franchise.

While wandering in Subnautica Below Zero, we explored the ecosystems and discussed their creation, inspirations for their elements and their scientific plausibility.

item.title: RPG session - The infected UFO
item.description:
To celebrate the 2024 One Ocean Week, an international event organized and supported by the United Nations, we organized a role-playing session in the Subnautica universe. Dalanthir, Lycoris, Shasotail and I were immersed in an original scenario written and animated by Yubels.

Follow the adventures of a crew dispatched to a distant ocean planet for a reconnaissance and rescue mission.

item.title: Physics, at large
item.description:
Members of the PogScience collective organized the first science marathon on Twitch. Thirteen streamers took turns throughout the event to offer continuous scientific content in French on the theme “Physics, at large” (in connection with the International Year of Physics). The 24h Vulga received support from the Centre National de la Recherche Scientifique français (CNRS).

I co-organized a livestream with Thomas Milan, from the channel Sciences à la Carte, where we hosted a knowledge quiz and presented capsules on the physical adaptations of species to abyssal conditions.

item.title: InstantOcean
item.description:
InstantOceans are video capsules created live with a science-on-demand format.

Using channel points during a livestream, viewers suggested a topic related to the oceans in the broadest sense: a scientific news, questions about concepts, debates, etc. I then searched the internet for information to address the topic and explain it.

The moderators also created “Ocean GuessR,” where they would give me clues to make me guess the region represented.

item.title: Chouettos Pass
item.description:
The Chouettos Pass is a level system offered to the community to increase interactivity during live broadcasts.

The goal is to accumulate experience to reach levels, which will unlock rewards. To do this, viewers must interact with the stream using their channel points , which will trigger various effects:

  • direct gains
  • science anecdotes competition
  • tchat mini games
  • in-game challenges
  • ...

On my channel, reaching levels 3, 5 and 8 unlocked premium command to modify live elements (camera filters, backgrounds, animations, etc.), and level 10 activated a gift card giveaway.

item.title: 24 hours of science
item.description:
I had the pleasure of producing and hosting a livestream for the 24 hours of science event. Live from both the Baromètre at the Université du Québec à Rimouski and on Twitch, we collaborated with Québec Océan to produce an exceptional evening featuring scientific discussions and online quizzes.

My guests were Gwénaëlle Chaillou (Ph.D.), professor of marine biogeochemistry, and Pierre Cauchy (Ph.D.), professor of marine acoustics.
